facts.title: Fact/Trivia 1
facts.body: Final Fantasy VII was originally planned for the SNES but moved to the PlayStation due to hardware limitations.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 2
facts.body: Cloud Strife's iconic weapon, the Buster Sword, is nearly six feet tall!

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 3
facts.body: Aerith Gainsborough was originally intended to survive, but her death became one of gaming's most iconic moments.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 4
facts.body: Final Fantasy VII's story draws inspiration from Norse mythology, particularly the Ragnarok legend.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 5
facts.body: The game features one of the first 3D cinematic cutscenes in gaming history.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 6
facts.body: Sephiroth's name comes from the Kabbalah, a mystical tradition of Judaism.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 7
facts.body: Red XIII's species is nearly extinct, making him one of the last of his kind.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 8
facts.body: The Chocobo theme has been present in every main Final Fantasy game since the second installment.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 9
facts.body: The original Japanese release of Final Fantasy VII had no analog stick support because the PlayStation DualShock controller wasn't released yet.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 10
facts.body: Tifa Lockhart was almost cut from the game during development but was retained to provide a love triangle dynamic with Cloud and Aerith.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 11
facts.body: The game's iconic villain, Sephiroth, originally had a theme song with lyrics in Japanese before 'One-Winged Angel' became his final theme with Latin lyrics.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 12
facts.body: The famous 'Gold Saucer' amusement park in Final Fantasy VII was inspired by Disneyland.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 13
facts.body: The summon 'Knights of the Round' requires breeding a gold chocobo to access its secret cave location.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 14
facts.body: Yuffie Kisaragi and Vincent Valentine are optional characters who can be missed entirely during a playthrough.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 15
facts.body: The game has a hidden 'date' mechanic where Cloud can end up on a date with Tifa, Aerith, Yuffie, or even Barret, depending on the player's choices.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 16
facts.body: The character of Cloud Strife was originally envisioned with black hair, but it was changed to blonde to stand out against the game's dark backdrops.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 17
facts.body: Final Fantasy VII has a debug room that can be accessed with cheats, allowing players to explore unfinished areas and mechanics.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 18
facts.body: Aerith’s house has a flower bed that, if trampled too much, triggers a humorous line from her about being careful.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 19
facts.body: The weapon 'Masamune Blade' in Sephiroth’s flashbacks can never be equipped by the player, as it’s exclusive to him.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 20
facts.body: The haunted hotel in the Gold Saucer is a subtle reference to *The Shining*, complete with spooky music and decor.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 21
facts.body: The ‘Wutai side quest’ is a hidden arc that adds depth to Yuffie’s character, involving stolen materia and the Turks.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 22
facts.body: If you name Red XIII as 'Nanaki,' his real name, it leads to funny dialogue moments when other characters act surprised.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 23
facts.body: In the Sector 7 slums, there’s a poster for 'Loveless,' a play referenced multiple times in the Final Fantasy VII universe.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 24
facts.body: In the Shinra building, there’s a bathroom on one of the floors that you can access to overhear enemy conversations.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 25
facts.body: The Midgar Zolom, an early-game enemy, foreshadows Sephiroth’s power as it’s found impaled on a tree later in the game.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 26
facts.body: Tifa's piano in Nibelheim can be played, and if you play a specific tune, you can unlock her Limit Break 'Final Heaven' later.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 27
facts.body: If you repeatedly refuse to climb the rope in the Corel Prison area, Barret will scold you in frustration.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 28
facts.body: If you keep Aerith in your party until the Temple of the Ancients, she will occasionally mention hearing voices from the Cetra.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 29
facts.body: The game features a hidden dialogue with a moogle in Mog's House mini-game, which teaches you about raising chocobos.

facts.title: Fact/Trivia 30
facts.body: Cid Highwind has a secret Limit Break called 'Highwind,' which is obtained from a chest in the sunken Gelnika plane.
